lines.content: * Represents the different possible commands allowed for Duke.
BYE, DONE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, LIST, DELETE, FIND
* Deadline is a sub-class of Task. It contains an additional variable, date as compared to Task.
* Returns the string representation of Deadline in the format [D][status] <description> (date: <date>).
String newdate = String.format("%d %s %d", this.date.getDayOfMonth(), this.date.getMonth(), this.date.getYear());
* Returns the string representation of deadline to be stored in a file.
* @return String representation to be stored in a file.
* Duke is a task-management system. It accept user commands to add/delete tasks, mark tasks as done and list all tasks.
* Upon exit, tasks will be saved and kept in a file for the next run.
* Constructs a Duke object. An attempt will be made to load in tasks from the file specified. If the file
* does not exist or cannot be accessed, an empty task list will be loaded.
* @param filePath Path of file containing saved data.
* Starts Duke. User will be able to input commands to perform actions.
* Event is a sub-class of Task. It contains an additional variable, date as compared to Task.
* Returns the string representation of Deadline in the format [E][status] <description> (at: <date>).
String newdate = String.format("%d %s %d", this.date.getDayOfMonth(), this.date.getMonth(), this.date.getYear());
* Returns the string representation of deadline to be stored in a file.
* @return String representation to be stored in a file.
* Parser handles making sense of input given. It divides the input into 3 main parts: command, description and date.
* @throws DukeException If the input given is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Task number is not an integer.");
* Returns the parameter from input. Parameter is used for "Done" and "Delete" commands
* Returns the description from input. Description is used for Tasks related commands.
* Returns the date from input. Date is used for "Deadline" and "Event" commands.
* Extracts the command given from the input.
* @throws DukeException If user input is invalid.
public static Command extractCommand(String input) throws DukeException {
* Extracts the parameter from user input.
* @throws DukeException If parameter was not provided.
public static String getFirstParameter(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ Why did you not provide any description?");
* Extract the date from user input.
* @throws DukeException If date was not provided.
public static LocalDate getDate(String input) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("☹ Why did you not provide the time?");
* Converts date in String format to LocalDate format.
* Date in String format must be of dd/mm/yyyy.
* @throws DukeException If date given is in wrong format.
public static LocalDate convertToLocalDate(String input) throws DukeException {
* Storage handles the reading and writing of tasks to and from a file. It handles converting of file data into
* Constructs a Storage object which store and read tasks saved in the specific file path.
* @param filePath Path of file to write and read saved tasks from.
* Writes new tasks to file. If Storage was previously unable to read in saved data due to invalid data or
* corrupted file, it wil overwrite the file.
* Reads saved tasks from file and convert them into Task objects and store them into a list.
* @return List of saved tasks from file.
* @throws DukeException If file is unable to be read properly or if data is invalid.
* Task contains information about a task, such as description and done status.
* Constructs a Task object. Initialized as undone.
* Returns the icon associated with the done status of the task.
* Check for done and cross for undone.
* Returns a Task object based of the information read from one line of the saved file.
* @param line One line from the saved file. Format: <task type> | <status> | <description> | <date>.
* @return Task object of the correct type.
* @throws DukeException If file is corrupt or the saved data is invalid.
public static Task getTaskFromMemory(String line) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Invalid file. File may have been corrupted.");
* Returns a string representation of the task including its done status icon and description.
* Returns the string representation of deadline to be stored in a file.
* @return String representation to be stored in a file.
* Converts date in String format to LocalDate format.
* Date in String format must be of dd/mm/yyyy.
* Converts date in LocalDate format back to String format.
* @return Date in String format of dd/mm/yyyy.
* TaskList represents a list of tasks and stores tasks. Uses ArrayList to store tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList object. Initialized as empty.
* Constructs a TaskList object. Initialized TaskList will contain tasks provided in a list.
* Returns the number of tasks in list.
* Adds a task into the list.
* @param task Task to be added into list
* Removes a specified task from the list.
* @param taskNum Task to be removed from the list.
* Sets a specified task from the list as done.
* @param taskNum Task number to be set as done.
* Returns a specified task from the task number given.
* @param taskNum Task number to be returned.
* Returns the string representation of a TaskList.
* Todo is a sub-class of Task. The only difference is the toString method.
* Returns the string representation of ToDo in the format [D][status] <description>.
* Ui handle tasks related to the user interface of Duke. It also handles user interaction, such as getting
* user input and generating replies from Duke.
* Constructs an Ui object. A scanner will be created upon object creation to read in user input.
* Prints the starting message when Duke starts.
System.out.println("> What can I do for you?");
* Prints the exit message when user ends a Duke session.
System.out.println("> Bye! Hope you don't come back!");
* Uses Scanner to read in from System.in.
* Prints out message showing the task the user added into the task list.
* @param task The task the user added into the list of tasks.
public void showAddedTask(TaskList tasks, Task task) {
System.out.printf("> Now you have %d tasks in your list.\n", tasks.getSize());
* Prints out message showing the task the user deleted from the task list.
* @param task The task the user deleted from the list of tasks.
public void showDeletedTask(TaskList tasks, Task task) {
System.out.println("> Do you really want to remove this?");
System.out.printf("> Now you have %d tasks in your list\n", tasks.getSize());
* Prints out message showing the task the user marked as done.
* @param task The task the user marked as done.
System.out.println("> I've finally done this task:");
* Prints out message showing task(s) that the user searched for.
* @param tasks The task(s) that the user searched for
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");

* Prints out an error message arising from reading in tasks from saved file.
* @param e Exception caught from trying to read the save file.
* Prints out all the tasks from the task list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks that you will never complete: ");
